intro: Cattleya × dominiana alba, commonly known as the white Cattleya, is a hybrid orchid that showcases striking white flowers with deep red or pink lip markings. Native to the tropical regions of South America, this plant thrives in warm, humid environments with bright indirect light. It is a sympodial orchid, meaning it grows in a branching pattern with pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. The flowers typically bloom in late spring or early summer, adding a dramatic display to gardens or indoor collections. Its unique coloration and elegant appearance make it a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts.
